body: close this guy too
+1 @robertkowalski, since you are a committer you can merge this in yourself :)
@deathbearbrown already merged for me, thank you! thanks for taking a look, highly appreciated! :)
@deathbearbrown can you give me some nice color values that help here? I would keep the log-level, but change the colors, that we are able to sort & search.

All http/ssl options pass through this piece of code;

```
ServerOpts = [Opt || {_, V}=Opt <- ServerOpts0, V /= nil],
```

so set all these new properties to evaluate to nil by default, and they'll be cleanly omitted from the configuration.
I'll merge this once you update for default behavior as noted (and please squash those into the appropriate commit).

Merged, please close the PR (limitation of our GH integration). I tested every parameter and made some (minor) bug fixes. I also updated the http.rst documentation to match.

Nice work, thanks!

Merged as 2fe69e704bf3520334082a03fcf07434eda44ea0 - thanks!

- The version text is now not shown in the collapsed view
- Fixed an issue with the scrollbar (collapsed scrollbar, scroll up & down, you will get a scrollbar in the view where the full-width-scrollbar is)

Regarding the logo:
I like the logo in the bottom and it's not a bug, more a thing of design and taste, so I did not address this point of the ticket in the commits currently. Can you create another follow-up ticket where we can discuss on that if it is a real issue for you? If we decide to move it elsewhere, I am happy to help!

I will squash some of the commits, once they are reviewed.
I wasn't able to reproduce the issue with the alignment of the icons. It looks like the whole webfont is not loaded.

I just added some tests :) 

Will merge tomorrow, glad you like it!
+1 for having logo issue separated.
As about icons alignment, the webfont is loaded correct (see chrome screenshots)

Cool, your patch fixes the issues, but introduces more new ones:

![Before PR 225](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12643268/COUCHDB-2234-chromium.png)
![After PR 225](http://i.imgur.com/joGshbB.png)

1) You'd fixed one horizontal scrollbar (global one, btw. that's old issue), but not the new one (see small grey line in all databases list frame at the bottom - that's it)
2) On collapsed sidebar unknown grey vertical line happens. I know that this should be scrollbar, but as side user, this doesn't oblivious for me and actually it doesn't scrolls.
3) Note, that icons alignment is broken now even more
4) Note, that FIX ADMIN PARTY button collapsed into two row items: one red and one dark grey (yes, these two rows are the single button: first one without fadein/fadeout effects on mouse over, second one with)

> 4) Note, that FIX ADMIN PARTY button collapsed into two row items: one red and one dark grey (yes, these two rows are the single button: first one without fadein/fadeout effects on mouse over, second one with)

Also, if you collapse/expand sidebar, you should note that icons are dancing. I hadn't found the issue rule yet, but strongly believe that this dance is related to broken FIX ADMIN PARTY button.
Great spot. Merge it.
The logo being at the bottom is part of the next design phase. It's not a bug

@robertkowalski looks much better! burger is really look fixed. but three moment are still remains: icons align, vertical grey line from disabled scrollbar in expanded mode on burger and horizontal browser scrollbar at the very bottom of databases list.
What is your OS, I am on OSX and can't reproduce.
Linux and Windows. Browsers: Firefox 29, Chromium 34, Chrome 35, Opera 12.
Wow it is really an impressive difference on a Windows Chrome. Haven't seen something extreme like this before on the same browser.
Heh, welcome to real world ((:
It is the rendering of the scrollbar from the `overlay-y: scroll` in the Chrome on Windows which are taking the space.

I think I fixed everything, except the horizontal scrollbar issue which was introduced in  319c48994aaff07b3273b489b4b82495c3def7c5, where the scrollbar was hidden behind the footer. So far no idea how to solve it, maybe @ocelotpotpie has an idea.
oh wait, it was introduced before that commit. investigating.
@kxepal seems that the horizontal scrollbar issue on windows was always there, but hidden behind the old footer element.

@robertkowalski oh..eastern egg!
Btw, quick looking into found that `id=dashboard-content` element has width in `style` attribute. Removing it fixes the issue (not breaks nothing for the first sight)
It is working good for single element dashboards, but will break for multipane views like "Tasks"
+1 works like a charm for Firefox and Chrome on Linux too.

Thank you so much for your contribution! 

There is still a little nit, if you open the "Logs" screen or any other dashboard with multiple panes, they will not get the full width, as before. This happens Windows and OSX.

**Before:**
![bildschirmfoto 2014-05-11 um 23 27 27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/298166/2939654/347b819e-d953-11e3-8099-29bb81086467.png)

**After applying the patch:**
![bildschirmfoto 2014-05-11 um 23 25 31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/298166/2939657/39828d7c-d953-11e3-8520-e1a331ec4f2f.png)

@robertkowalski oh, you're right. 
btw, how about removing `class="window-resizeable"` from `dashboard-content`? It causes the issue, but removing it doesn't harm on window/content resize ability.

@robertkowalski hm..so may be instead of removing fix the width size? if it's required (as far as I see - some tabs are becomes broken without it, some tabs got hscroll issue fixed), it seems that calculated value is a bit more than required.

indeed - mea culpa; but there was never a scrollbar issue with a sidebar anyways, so either we do as Alexander said or I checked in a revised version that (at least on my chrome) looks like your "before" screenshot

Actually I have to run, but I can get back 2night (Europe)

Don't remove window-resizeable it is used.

Hey @robertkowalski this is great work. Just some small minor changes. Other than that looking great. I just want to know why you using localStorage to keep track of deletes?
@robertkowalski, @kxepal I think we need to get @ocelotpotpie involved in this one.

This is a nice idea a couple things need to be fixed before we can merge:
- The general filters view needs to be moved to `fauxton/components.js`
- Use RouteObject events instead of a views.changesEvent
- Having the filter on the side uses up to much space. The filter section should go above the changes display. Once the the first two items are fixed we can get Sean, the UX expert, to mockup a nice UI for the filter.
Cool by me. Thanks, @garrensmith

one harsh alternative would be setting overflow-x to hidden on #dashboard (probably with selector limited down a little more). It produces the same result that (the revised) max-width does: one scroll bar:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7339874/2950209/0bddf5da-da18-11e3-8b06-f6430c709569.png)

I doubt that overflow-x is less invasive, however. I did not find a way to tweak the width set by resizeColumns.js so that it produces a better result.

on an even smaller win (both CSS flavors look exactly the same): 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7339874/2950230/459cd034-da18-11e3-97c7-c1fe6e4ad709.png)
@gdamjan Aside from the typo it looks good overall. Would you mind fixing it so I can commit it?

LGTM, +1 for mergeship.
Here is the problem: local docs may not be available, especially if you're not uses release version.

Not yet - it causes an etap test failure to do with replication, which I haven't tracked down.

Nick

> On 15 May 2014, at 09:06, interactiveblueprints notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> @NorthNick Has this been merged with couchdb master?
> 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.

Here is the problem: remote docs may not be available, especially if your internet connection is slow or not available at all.

Under which circumstances is the local documentation not available? I only know the case where it's not available when building with `make dev` and starting CouchDB via `./utils/run`.

In my opinion, it's totally ok when the link to the documentation doesn't work in that case, as this most likely only affects CouchDB developers; and running `make` and `make install` fixes the issue for them as well.

Just recall that we could apply [COUCHDB-1658](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/COUCHDB-1658) [patch](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12567123/COUCHDB-1658.1.patch) that could be the solution for missed local docs. And then this PR makes links right. In case of missed local docs you'll be just redirected to online ones instead of browsing 404 page.
